entry.title: [GSOC 2015] P2PSP GUI Project Progress upto MidTerm Evaluation:
entry.content:
I hope to have completed my midterm milestone.Below are the notable features in current P2PSP GUI project.For more information about the implementaion,discussions and changes in this period go through the gui branch at p2psp repo , Pull Requests on github and the links provided in each week.

Week 1(A P2PSP Peer(channel) played in Gui's player):

  • On clicking player's play button ,a default peer(using localhost to connect to the splitter) is started and played.
  • Visibility of widget displaying channels can be toggled from menu bar.
  • Fullscreen feature introduced in player.

Pull Requests:

  • channel window visibility can be toggled and stream played

  • resolving merge conflicts for PR(#13)

Week 2(Gui Architecture):

  • App structured and source code refactored following MVC Pattern.

Pull Requests:

  • Gui Architecture

  • Proposal with minor changes related with naming and directory structure.

Week 3(displaying more information about current playing channel) :

  • A progress bar(located above player) is used to display buffer status(only when it is updated).
  • Download/Upload Speed and peers in team displayed.
  • More Exception Handling is done(using decorator).

Pull Requests:

  • Display down/up speed and Users

  • Fix for issues: #30 #32

  • Fix for Issues : #34 #35

Week 4(Channels can be exported to a JSON File and vice-versa):

  • First importing and exporting channels were tested without gui.
  • channels can be imported and exported according to the format discussed in this issue.
  • channels can be played by double clicking the icons in gui,again default peer is played.Channel description is dispayed as tooltip of icons.

Pull Requests:

  • importing/exporting channels

  • Display channels in Channel box

  • thumbnail size increased , channel description shown as tooltip

entry.title: Google Summer Of Code with P2PSP
entry.content:
27 April 12 AM, I had opened Google Summer of code 2015 Accepted Projects page on my laptop for a few minutes. I heard my other two friends have been selected.I was nervous and stuck at "loading" on the webpage. Suddenly one of my friends came and told me that I have been selected.Next I was screaming and literally jumped over him!

My Project INTEGRATION OF GUI,PLAYER AND PEER FOR THE P2PSP PYTHON IMPLEMENTATION has been accepted by mentoring organisation P2P2SP.org.

P2PSP.org

P2PSP.org is a nonprofit organization that develops the P2PSP protocol. P2PSP is an application layer protocol designed for the real-time streaming of multimedia content over the Internet.Learn more about P2PSP Protocol at P2PSP Webpage.

P2PSP-GUI Project

The main aim of this project is to use LibVLC (a media framework that embeds the features of VLC into an application) to integrate a peer and a player into a single executable.

Project mentors are:

  • Cristóbal Medina López
  • José Juan Sánchez

For more information about the project please check out my proposal and keep updated with the blog.
